content:
The preamble can be customized with this add-on:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/changequote/

Add-on Options/Reply header/Customized reply header, e.g. %%6 wrote on %%5 about %%4:
creator: sfhowes

content:
Netuším, proč se nezobrazují jen "některé" štítky. Sám je nepoužívám. Zkus projít toto, možná najdeš řešení. Štítky zpráv – třídění zpráv v Thunderbirdu

Případně zkus Thunderbird spustit v Režimu řešení potíží (z menu Nápověda).
creator: poljos-moz

content: Menu > Impostazioni > Privacy e sicurezza > Indesiderata Spunta la casella Quando i messaggi sono segnati come posta indesiderata: e poi attiva l'opzione Eliminali
creator: @next

content: Direi che devi segnalare il problema Tim. Non c'è modo di forzare Thunderbird ad usare protocolli o impostazioni che non supporta. In genere comunque si tratta di problemi transitoriche i postmaster risolvono in breve tempo.
creator: @next

content: Nell'inoltro la firma non viene messa per ragioni di netiquete. La firma finirebbe infatti in fondo al messaggio inoltrato lasciando intendere che questo sia opera del mittente attuale.
creator: @next

content: Options set in the Settings pane apply to all accounts. You might look for an addon that addresses that.
creator: davidsk

content:

content: the importexport addon is still alive and well. just click the addons option from hamburger menu or tools>addons from menu bar - and then enter the word import into search box and it pops right up. This may not work if you are using beta version,
creator: davidsk

content: But I need to export from the old computer. There is only one big export button which seems to want to export everything. If I remember I could export each folder independently in the past.
creator: karin32

content: What is it that you want to do? The importexport addon also exports.
creator: davidsk

content:
This is not a Thunderbird issue, and you are well advised to work with a legitimate mailing service. Your mail is classified as spam or not spam by the recipient, so it's not your call. Generally, email providers do not like any of this because it can get their servers blacklisted. And even mailchimp can't protect you ( I once administered a large mailing list with mailchimp, with all subscribers having done two-step subscriptions, yet for approx 5 months almost 1/3 of recipients did not receive the mailings - which came from a government organization. )

Being an author myself, I respect your desire to reach people, but we cannot judge what is and isn't spam, and providing assistance in mass mailings would put us in that situation. But I wish you well. (And this is a personal opinion, not necessarily what the big wigs at Thunderbird might do.)
creator: davidsk
